title: (x) Art Deco custom house numbers - Tasmin (Tango) {Mike F}
content:
I have a friend that would like to make his house numbers from the font samples indicated.

Does anyone know what it could be?

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [house numbers.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150202004057/http:/typophile.com/files/house%20numbers.jpg) | 142.73 KB |
author: umlautthoni

comments.content: Looks like some variant of Desdemona

Nope. That's an old typeface called Tasmin (Bold, I believe). Unfortunately, the only digital version I'm aware of is called Tango Regular by WSI - a company that made its living selling batches of knockoff fonts to software companies who then bundled them with its software.

Edit: Mike Yanega offers a [showing of Tasmin](http://web.archive.org/web/20150202004057/http:/bowfinprintworks.com/BauhausFaces6.html) including numerals.

I had the opportunity to speak with the designer directly. (Contact info was on the back of the Calendar.) She told me it was indeed Tango. However, I think she may have thought I was the font usage police. I have been unsuccessful in trying to find a place to purchase Tango, but really the link displaying Tasmin Bold will do very nicely!

Thank you very much!
